intro: Peucedanum lavrentiadis, commonly known as the Lavrentiadis angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its rarity and limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
